snippet: An exhibition opening on Tuesday in Boston includes newly released correspondence and other documents relating to Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, the couple executed in 1953 for espionage.
abstract: Exhibition Love-Conscience-Conviction: The Rosenberg Case, opening in Boston, includes newly released letters and other documents from Julius and Ethel Rosenberg related to affair that once riveted nation and stoked Cold War fears that Soviet Union had stolen America’s atomic weapons secrets.
lead_paragraph: An exhibition opening on Tuesday in Boston includes newly released correspondence and other documents relating to Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, the couple executed in 1953 for espionage.

headline.main: Newly Released Letters Illuminate Rosenbergs’ Parental Anxieties
headline.print_headline: Letters Show Rosenbergs Had Worries About Sons
